title: Ethereum Staking Explained: Is ETH Staking Worth It? - CoinCodex
summary:
Ethereum staking is now available, and ETH holders can earn rewards by staking their coins. The Ethereum network has transitioned to a Proof-of-Stake (PoS) consensus mechanism, which allows validators to stake ETH in exchange for participating in the consensus process. Stakers can earn rewards for adding new blocks to the Ethereum blockchain and for checking the validity of transactions. The rewards vary depending on the number of validators active on the network and network activity.

There are different ways to stake ETH, including solo staking, staking as a service, staking pools, and staking through crypto exchanges. Solo staking requires 32 ETH to launch a validator, while staking as a service and staking pools allow users to stake smaller amounts of ETH. Crypto exchanges also offer Ethereum staking services, but they take a cut of the rewards.

The benefits of staking ETH include passive income growth, decentralization, and the ability to contribute to the security of the Ethereum network. However, there are also risks involved

title: BlackRock Wants to Follow Bitcoin ETF With an Ethereum ETF. Marketing It Might Not Be So Simple - CoinDesk
summary: BlackRock, the world's largest asset manager, is considering launching an Ethereum ETF following the success of its Bitcoin ETF. However, marketing the product may be challenging due to a conundrum in selling a spot ether ETF, according to CF Benchmarks, an index provider.

title: Ethereum outperforms Bitcoin by 20%, but how long can ETH hold $2.5K support? - Cointelegraph
summary:
Ethereum (ETH) has outperformed Bitcoin (BTC) by 20% since Jan. 8, with ETH rallying 20% between Jan. 8 and Jan. 11, but struggling to sustain the $2,600 level. The subsequent 3.5% correction down to $2,560 on Jan. 16 may have disappointed some bulls. Despite this, Ether's price has outperformed Bitcoin by 19.5% since Jan. 8.

However, it is unclear if the $2,500 level will hold, as the most obvious drivers are not expected in the short term, such as the Ethereum spot exchange-traded fund (ETF) and the planned Ethereum network upgrades. While these events present an opportunity for Ether to further decouple from the remaining cryptocurrency market, they also present a risk if they either backfire or are postponed.

Ether usually does not outperform Bitcoin by 15% or higher in a week, and the latest instance happened 14 months ago.

title: NFT wash trading volumes on Ethereum marketplaces hit lowest level in more than a year - The Block
summary: NFT wash trading volumes on Ethereum marketplaces have hit their lowest level in over a year, according to The Block's Data Dashboard. The percentage of trading volumes associated with wash trading has decreased significantly, from 36.2% on Jan. 1 to 1.8% on Jan. 9 and 13. NFT platforms such as LooksRare, X2Y2, and Blur have made changes to dissuade wash trading, including phasing out trading rewards programs and filtering wash traders from airdrops. This decline in wash trading is attributed to the valuations of NFT marketplace tokens dropping and increased efforts to combat wash trading.

title: Ethereum Throughput Tags Record High As Burn Rate Drives Down ETH Supply - The Defiant - DeFi News
summary: Ethereum's throughput hit a record high of nearly 2M transactions on January 14, driven by a persistently high burn rate that is reducing the supply of Ether. Despite this, ETH investors are optimistic, with the asset holding strong amid a sell-off in Bitcoin following the launch of the first spot Bitcoin ETFs. The supply of ETH has been falling steadily since September 2022, with Uniswap being the leading source of burned Ether.

title: Ethereum: What Q1 2024 holds for investors - AMBCrypto English
summary: Ethereum faced volatility in Q1 2024, but on-chain metrics showed resilience. Despite a drop in estimated leverage ratio, the MVRV ratio remained high, indicating holder confidence. The weighted sentiment peaked during the price rally but fell since then. Active addresses and transaction volume also trended higher, indicating steady network usage. Despite futures traders' diminished bullish sentiment, Ethereum's prices are expected to climb higher in Q1 2024.

title: Ethereum’s Dencun Upgrade Goes Live, But Fails to Finalize on Testnet - CoinDesk
summary: Ethereum's Dencun upgrade has gone live, but failed to finalize on testnet. The upgrade aims to improve the network's scalability and security. Despite the failure, the project will continue to move forward with plans for Consensus 2024, a major crypto event where all sides of the industry will come together to discuss the future of blockchain and Web3. Learn more and register for Consensus at consensus.coindesk.com.

A clear move above $2,585 could lead to a decent increase towards $2,650, while a failure to clear this resistance could result in another decline towards $2,495. title: Spot Ethereum ETF not coming 'anytime soon,' says Mark Yusko - Cointelegraph
summary: Mark Yusko, co-founder and CEO of Morgan Creek Capital, believes that a spot Ethereum ETF will not be approved by the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) "anytime soon." Despite the recent approval of the first spot Bitcoin ETF, Yusko argues that the SEC remains hostile towards cryptocurrencies and may still regard Ether as a security. He also predicts that the approval of the Bitcoin ETF will reduce the asset's volatility and potential returns, signifying its maturation.

title: Ethereum Classic Maintains 32% Steady Rise – What’s Driving ETC Up? - NewsBTC

Trading volume has increased by 270% to $1.8 billion, with a trading value around $26. Industry experts anticipate ETC reaching $30 soon, fueled by its impressive trading volume and market capitalization. However, the cryptocurrency market is inherently volatile, and unforeseen factors can alter market dynamics. The recent ascent of Ethereum Classic highlights the interconnectedness of the cryptocurrency market and the significant impact of regulatory decisions.

title: US ETF market heats up with Ethereum: what you need to know - crypto.news
summary: The US ETF market is heating up with the launch of Ethereum ETFs, which could potentially propel the crypto market to new heights. The SEC has approved several Bitcoin ETFs, and now investors can speculate on the price movements of ETH without directly owning it. Investor interest in Ethereum may reignite if its prices recover, and market players such as ProShares, Bitwise, and VanEck have debuted their Ethereum funds. Ark Invest and BlackRock have also applied for spot Ethereum ETFs, and analysts believe that these applications will be approved within a year. However, SEC Chair Gary Gensler is exercising caution on Ethereum, emphasizing that the approval of Bitcoin ETFs was specific to Bitcoin as a non-security commodity token.

title: Ethereum L2 Blast Tempts Developers With Airdrop After Users Lock Up $1.3 Billion - Decrypt
summary:
Sure, here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Blast, an Ethereum layer-2 scaling network, has launched its testnet and is offering airdropped tokens to users who have deposited over $1.3 billion worth of cryptocurrency. The project is also hosting a "Big Bang" competition for developers to build on the platform and earn a share of the airdrop. Blast's launch follows a similar strategy to Blur, the leading NFT marketplace, which handed out over $800 million worth of tokens in 2023. However, the launch has faced pushback from users and fellow developers due to the platform's approach to taking deposits before the mainnet was ready and blocking withdrawals.

title: Ethereum PoS validator count falls to YTD low: What’s next? - AMBCrypto News

Momentum indicators such as RSI and MFI are at high levels, suggesting continued buying pressure. However, a minor drawback in ETH's value may be anticipated due to overheating.

title: Here’s What Drove Ethereum’s Record 650K+ ETH Staking Exodus - DailyCoin
summary:
Here's what drove Ethereum's record 650K+ ETH staking exodus:

* Celsius' bankruptcy proceedings are linked to the surge in staked ETH withdrawals, with the firm unstaking ETH to offset restructuring costs and settle creditors.
* Figment, a staking service provider, is also a significant contributor to the withdrawal spike, with over 356K ETH withdrawn.
* The move is unlikely to cause dire consequences for the Ethereum network, as the staking contract still holds over 36 million ETH and the unstaking wait time is limited by the "churn limit."
* Despite the withdrawals, the price of ETH continues to hold steady, with some analysts predicting a potential surge above $3,500.
* Other bankrupt crypto firms, such as FTX and Alameda, have also unloaded ETH holdings to settle creditors in the past week.

title: Under-the-Radar Ethereum Rival Jumps Nearly 40% in Hours Amid a Proposed Blockchain Merger - The Daily Hodl
summary:
Sure, here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Klaytn, a South Korean Ethereum rival, saw a nearly 40% gain in hours after a proposed blockchain merger was announced. The merger aims to create Asia's leading blockchain system by combining Klaytn and Finschia's blockchains. The native token of Klaytn, KLAY, is up 17% in the last 24 hours and is being swapped for new native tokens once issued. The merger promises to enhance decentralization, governance, and interoperability with other blockchains.

title: Ethereum ETFs in Focus As Spot Bitcoin Funds Launch - etf.com
summary: Ethereum ETFs are gaining attention as spot bitcoin funds have listed on US stock exchanges. While ethereum is not yet available in spot form, existing ETFs offer a way for investors to gain exposure. The dominant player in this space is the $7.6 billion Grayscale Ethereum Trust, which is seeking to convert to a spot ethereum fund. Other competitors include ProShares Ether Strategy ETF, VanEck Ethereum Strategy ETF, and Bitwise Ethereum Strategy ETF. However, these newer ETFs have lower expense ratios than Grayscale. The article notes that if the US Securities and Exchange Commission treats ethereum ETFs with skepticism, it could impact the industry's growth.

title: Ethereum Trouncing Bitcoin, ETH/BTC Ratio Bouncing Higher: Will This Trend Continue? - NewsBTC
summary: Ethereum (ETH) is outperforming Bitcoin (BTC) in the crypto market, with the ETH/BTC ratio rising and ETH momentum building. The rebound is fueled by growing optimism around the potential approval of spot Ethereum ETFs and increased confidence in the SEC approving a similar product for ETH. BlackRock, a leading Wall Street giant, is interested in issuing a spot Ethereum ETF. However, the SEC has yet to clarify whether ETH is a commodity or security. Despite this uncertainty, ETH is expected to continue outperforming BTC in the coming months, with price action data showing a 20% increase in ETH versus BTC in the past trading week.

title: Nayms Launches on Ethereum Layer-2 Solution Base, Offering Tokenized Alternative Risk Transfer - The Tokenizer
summary: Nayms, a blockchain-based marketplace for alternative risk transfer and capitalization, has launched on Base, a secure and low-cost Ethereum layer-2 solution. This collaboration aims to provide investors with streamlined access to tokenized (re)insurance opportunities, revolutionizing the insurance industry by leveraging blockchain technology. The first product launched is an Industry Loss Warranty (ILW) contract reinsuring against weather-related catastrophic events in Florida, offering target returns ranging from mid to high teens. Institutional investors can earn yield on their capital within a Bermuda-regulated segregated account structure and enjoy an additional reward of NAYM tokens equivalent to up to 15% of their invested capital. Tokenization provides institutional investors with a unique avenue to diversify their portfolios and access historically challenging private markets in a tokenized wrapper. The ILW market targeted by Nayms generates over $300 billion in annual renewal premiums and introduces an innovative approach by safeguarding buyers against named windstorms in Florida. Nayms' traceable smart contract

title: Ethereum ETF: Crypto Analyst Sells Bitcoin For Ethereum Amid ETF Anticipation - CoinGape
summary: Crypto analyst Crypto Rover sold a substantial portion of his Bitcoin holdings to buy Ethereum (ETH) due to the upcoming Spot Ethereum ETFs and a major Ethereum upgrade expected in the next four months. He believes Ethereum has a better upside than Bitcoin and expects the coupled impact of these events to propel Ethereum's price up significantly. Rover has begun selling off Bitcoin when it neared $49,000 and expects a surge past $43,500 before a correction. He will place buy orders for BTC when the price falls around $39,750, indicating a massive correction. However, if Bitcoin breaks the resistance at $44,500 and sustains over it, a massive surge could follow.

title: Manta Pacific hits $850M TVL becoming Ethereum's 4th largest L2 - Crypto Briefing
summary: Manta Pacific, an Ethereum layer-2 blockchain, has reached $850M in TVL, making it the 4th largest L2 by TVL. This growth is attributed to the New Paradigm campaign which offered rewards to users who bridged Ethereum to Manta Pacific. However, the value locked growth has not been accompanied by a rise in activity, suggesting that the money flowing into Manta Pacific is from investors only interested in the airdrop. As a result, the token distribution could signal the end of the mandatory lock-up period for ETH in Manta Pacific, with investors potentially moving their funds to other protocols where staking is required.

title: Tron Investors Show More Interest in Ethereum and Retik Finance - Crypto Reporter
summary: Tron investors are shifting their attention to Ethereum and Retik Finance, two platforms that offer diversification and innovation beyond Tron's ecosystem. Ethereum's long-standing stability and commitment to scalability and energy efficiency appeal to investors, while Retik Finance's disruptive approach to decentralized finance has gained significant traction. This shift reflects a maturing investor base that seeks new opportunities and contributes to the evolution of the blockchain and cryptocurrency space. Retik Finance's innovative suite of financial solutions, including futuristic DeFi debit cards, smart crypto payment gateways, and AI-powered P2P lending, has captured the attention of Tron investors.

title: Buterin Explains Ethereum's New Rollup Strategy - U.Today
summary: Vitalik Buterin explained the difference between traditional Ethereum rollups and "Validium" solutions, which use external data chains for data availability. While rollups offer an unconditional security guarantee, using external chains may not be as robust. The Ethereum community debated the implications of integrating external chains and the potential complexity and security concerns. Despite these concerns, some believe categorizing solutions as "layer 2" remains effective for communication purposes.

title: Manta Pacific Overtakes Base as 4th Largest Ethereum L2 - Coinspeaker
summary: Manta Pacific, a layer 2 scaling solution for Ethereum, has surpassed Coinbase's Base as the fourth-largest scaling solution, with a TVL of $850 million. Manta Pacific's rise to prominence is attributed to its zero-knowledge rollup technology and paradigm bridging program, which incentivizes users to transfer assets to its network. Binance has also introduced MANTA as its 44th project on the Launchpool, allowing users to earn MANTA tokens by staking BNB and FDUSD. The integration with Binance introduces a modular Layer 2 solution tailored for Zero-Knowledge applications.

title: Ethereum (ETH) vs Retik Finance (RETIK), Which Giant Will Give Better Returns in 2024? - Finbold - Finance in Bold
summary:
Ethereum (ETH) and Retik Finance (RETIK) are both popular cryptocurrencies in the market, but they have different strengths and weaknesses. Ethereum is the pioneer in blockchain technology and has been around for longer, while Retik Finance is a newer entrant that aims to address scalability issues and provide a more user-friendly experience. Here are some key points to consider when deciding which cryptocurrency to invest in:

Ethereum (ETH):

* Long-standing pioneer in blockchain technology
* Wide adoption and compatibility with a large number of tokens and projects
* High gas fees and scalability issues
* Upcoming Ethereum 2.0 upgrade aims to address scalability concerns

Retik Finance (RETIK):

* Focuses on scalability solutions and lowering transaction costs
* Community-driven platform with a governance structure
* Innovative technologies and partnerships to enhance the user experience
* Raised $1 million in presale and attracted almost $6 million in less than a month
* Potential giant poised to deliver

Bitcoin (BTC) remains dominant despite a brief breach below the 50-day EMA, with its ability to push back above the level a sign of its underlying strength.

summary: Ethereum's price has faced a significant obstacle after a recent surge, correcting and potentially targeting $2,400. Technical analysis indicates the price is still bullish, with the Relative Strength Index above 50%. However, derivatives market sentiment is concerning, with a drop in the Taker Buy Sell Ratio. Despite this, the overall market structure is still bullish, with the price likely to continue its uptrend after a correction.

title: How Ethereum restaking is slowly gaining traction - AMBCrypto News
summary: Ethereum restaking protocols are gaining traction, with EigenLayer leading the way. The protocol saw a 6x jump in total value locked (TVL) to $1.67 billion, with native ETH deposits doubling in the past week. Other protocols, such as EtherFi and Renzo Protocol, also experienced significant increases in deposits. This trend suggests that restaking is becoming a popular option for Ethereum stakers, allowing them to participate in validating new software modules while also earning extra yield.

title: Self-Proclaimed Satoshi Craig Wright Takes Dig at Ethereum's Vitalik Buterin - U.Today
summary: Self-proclaimed Satoshi Craig Wright criticized Ethereum's Vitalik Buterin, revisiting his past remarks on building Ethereum on top of Bitcoin. Wright argued that Ethereum only exists due to centralized development teams and that a more streamlined system would exist if everything were built on Bitcoin. This fuels the ongoing rivalry between Bitcoin and Ethereum, with Wright advocating for the stability and originality of Bitcoin's protocol. The comments also revive the centralization debate in both cryptocurrency ecosystems, with OFAC's censorship of ETH transactions and the concentration of BTC in the hands of whales and miners.

title: An Introduction to ERC-4337 (Account Abstraction) Standard - Unchained - Unchained
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

ERC-4337 is a new token standard for Ethereum that enables account abstraction, making it easier for users to interact with smart contracts and reduce the complexity of managing private keys.

Key features of ERC-4337 include user operations, bundlers, entry points, and paymasters. The standard works by initiating UserOps, bundling transactions, and validating signatures.

Benefits of ERC-4337 include enhanced security, cross-chain compatibility, potential scalability, support for multi-party transactions, and social wallet recovery. However, there are also limitations, such as increased DoS risk, limited transaction volumes, and potentially higher gas costs.

The ERC-4337 standard has the potential to fundamentally transform Ethereum and make it easier for users to interact with smart contracts, but it also has its downsides.
